Trial_Design.evidence: Z11102 was a multicenter trial enrolling women with 2 or 3 separate sites of biopsy proven malignancy separated by ≥2 cm within the same breast.

Participants.evidence: Z11102 was a multicenter trial enrolling women with 2 or 3 separate sites of biopsy proven malignancy separated by ≥2 cm within the same breast.

Intervention.evidence: All patients undergoing successful breast-conserving therapy were treated with whole breast radiation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Cosmetic outcome data for 216 eligible women who completed therapy are included in this analysis.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 136 patients who completed the survey 2 years postoperatively, 70.6% ( N=96) felt the result was good or excellent while 3.7% (N=5) felt the result was poor.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean satisfaction score on the BREAST-Q was 77.2 six months following whole breast radiation and 73.7 three years following surgery.
